conclusion: Vertex angle of isosceles prism ABC is 30°, side length of AB is L, light DO hits midpoint O of AB, incident angle is 45°, light exits perpendicular to AC, speed of light in vacuum is C.
Find the length of the path that the light travels inside the prism.
Light travels along the diagonal of the prism.
Height of prism is h = L * sin(30°) = L/2.
Using Pythagorean theorem, diagonal length d = L√5/2.
Assume refractive index n = 1 for simplicity.
Speed of light in prism v = c/n.
Propagation time of light in the prism is L√5/2c.
